FT Faculty Headcount:
Overview:
The Spring 2015 Excel file summarizes the Faculty & Student Credit Hour, Student Headcount Report for Central Connecticut State University. It details the teaching load, student enrollment, and course sections taught across departments, separating data by full-time (FT) and part-time (PT) faculty. It also shows the percentage of credit hours delivered by each group, highlighting instructional balance across colleges.

Abbreviations Explained:

FT = Full-Time (faculty employed full-time)

PT = Part-Time (faculty employed part-time)

Faculty Headcount = Number of faculty members teaching courses

Student Credit Hr = Total student credit hours taught (indicator of instructional activity)

Credit Hr/Faculty = Average credit hours taught per faculty member

Student Headcount = Number of students enrolled in courses taught

Student Headcount/Faculty = Average number of students taught per faculty member

Sections Taught = Number of course sections delivered

% Credit Hr by FT Faculty / PT Faculty = Proportion of student credit hours taught by full-time vs. part-time faculty
